choices.D: Create a data source based on the Excel worksheet and create a calculated field based on Start Date. Add the calculated field to the extract filter.
choices.B: Create a custom SQL query that references Start Date in the WHERE clause.
choices.A: Create a data source based on the Excel worksheet and create a calculated field based on Start Date. From the Data pane add the calculated field to the data source filter.
choices.C: Create a custom SQL query to define the data source and create a calculated field based on Start Date. Add the calculated field to the extract filter.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D
Once connected to a data source , we can edit extract filter then add filter of start date

questions.question_text:
You have a dashboard that contains a parameter named Start Date.

You need to create an extract from a Microsoft Excel file. The extract must be filtered based on Start Date.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Blend works on primary data source i.e Left Join

Selected Answer: B
B. Left join
Data blending simulates a traditional left join.
Blend works like a left join

Selected Answer: AB
A. Image
B. PDF

Selected Answer: AB
To receive a subscription, users must have the View and Download Image/PDF permissions.

questions.question_text:
You plan to create a Tableau subscription for several users.

Which two formats can you use? (Choose two.)

questions.question_text:
You have a Tableau workbook.

You want to make the workbook available in Tableau Online.

What should you do?

choices.A: From the File menu select Export Packaged Workbook
choices.C: From the Server menu, select Tableau Public and then select Save to Tableau Public
choices.D: From the Server menu select Publish Workbook
choices.B: From the Server menu, select Publish Data Source
